docs.snippet: For the first time in our nearly 20-year history, The Learning Network will be in print. Pick up a copy on April 8.

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Tuesday:

headline.main: The Latest: Iowa Senator: Trade Dispute Unfair to US Farmers
headline.print_headline: The Latest: Iowa Senator: Trade Dispute Unfair to US Farmers

docs.snippet: China will take counter-measures of the "same proportion" and scale if the United States imposes further tariffs on Chinese goods, China's ambassador to Washington said, amid growing fears of an impending trade war.

headline.main: China Ready for Proportionate Response to U.S. Tariffs-Envoy
headline.print_headline: China Ready for Proportionate Response to U.S. Tariffs-Envoy

docs.snippet: Last month, anchors at local news stations across the country made identical comments about media bias. The script came from their owner, Sinclair Broadcast Group.

headline.main: Sinclair Made Dozens of Local News Anchors Recite the Same Script
headline.print_headline: Sinclair Told Anchors To Recite Script on Bias

byline.original: By JACEY FORTIN and JONAH ENGEL BROMWICH

docs.snippet: Monday: Stephen Reinhardt’s legacy on the Ninth Circuit, President Trump vows “No More DACA Deal,” and a student mulls Stanford — along with 19 other schools.

headline.main: California Today: Remembering the Legacy of a Liberal Judge

docs.snippet: China raised import duties on a $3 billion list of U.S. pork, apples and other products Monday in an escalating dispute with Washington over trade and industrial policy.

headline.main: China Raises Tariffs on US Pork, Fruit in Trade Dispute
headline.print_headline: China Raises Tariffs on US Pork, Fruit in Trade Dispute

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Monday:
Tesla’s inability to meet production goals and the E.P.A.’s easing of mileage rules may delay electrification of vehicles, but it still will happen.

headline.main: Tesla’s Manufacturing ‘Hell’ Won’t Slow Down Electric Cars
headline.print_headline: Tesla’s Problems Won’t Stop Electric Cars
